definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)

sentences.english: The most woeful thing is hand twitching wakes you up and cash counting ending naturally.
sentences.chinese: 睡覺睡到手抽筋，數錢數到自然醒。

sentences.english: I have no cramps and I feel strong.
sentences.chinese: 我手腳沒有抽筋，我感到身強力壯。

sentences.english: He rubbed the cramped hand against his trousers and tried to gentle the fingers.
sentences.chinese: 他把那隻抽筋的手在褲子上擦擦，想使手指鬆動鬆動。
我是喬正在抽筋的腹股溝。

sentences.english: If you run up and get a cramp: hm.
sentences.chinese: 如果你跑起來然後抽筋了，啊。

sentences.english: My legs twitched constantly after climbing the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 我爬山之後兩條腿一直都在抽筋。

sentences.english: Don’t let your subject suck in her stomach. To do that a person has to hold their breath.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓您的模特屏住呼吸屏到胃抽筋。

sentences.english: you're going to end up developing a cramp or a long term injury.
sentences.chinese: 到最後你會抽筋，或者會造成長期的傷害。

sentences.english: Don't let your subject suck in her stomach.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓您的模特屏住呼吸屏到胃抽筋。

sentences.english: I experienced a minor muscle pull in my lower back yesterday and also a foot cramp.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我的腰有些酸，腳也有點抽筋。

sentences.english: Nadal returned to announce he felt cramp in his thigh.
sentences.chinese: 納達爾從頭承受拜候，說他年夜腿抽筋了。

sentences.english: Antispasmodics are used to treat abdominal pain by relieving the spasms in the muscles of the intestines.
sentences.chinese: 止痙攣藥是藉着減輕小腸肌肉抽筋而得以治療腹痛。

sentences.english: Taking the proper amount of magnesium a day also helps to decrease the leg cramps and constipation often experienced during pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 適當補充鎂也有助減少懷孕期腿抽筋和便祕等問題。

sentences.english: Any attempts to stop either of them means breaking of bones of India by both of them.
sentences.chinese: 任何此類嘗試都意味着印度會被抽筋斷骨。

sentences.english: his left hand was still cramped, but he was unknotting it slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他的左手傲然在抽筋，但他正在逐步地把它伸開。

sentences.english: As her husband twitched on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，她老公也倒在地上抽筋。

definition: to feel suffocated or oppressed/to choke with resentment/to feel injured or resentful
calf (back of the leg below the knee)
to kick one's legs/leg press (exercise)/(coll.) to kick the bucket
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
to weaken/to go soft (at the knees)
